feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for New Zealand issued by MetService
feed.rights: Copyright Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited, 2025. Licensed under Creative Commons BY 4.0.

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 50 to 90 mm of rain about the main divide, and 40 to 70 mm within 20 km farther east. Thunderstorms possible, with peak rain rates of 20 to 30 mm/h expected about the divide. Rain easing from the south. Freezing level about 2000 metres, lowering to 1600 metres Friday afternoon. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Severe gale northerly gusting 120 km/h in exposed places. Impact: Damage to trees, powerlines, and unsecured structures possible. Driving may be difficult, especially for high-sided vehicles and motorcycles. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Severe gale northwest gusting 120 km/h in exposed places. Impact: Damage to trees, powerlines, and unsecured structures possible. Driving may be difficult, especially for high-sided vehicles and motorcycles. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain, and amounts may approach warning criteria. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain, easing for a time this afternoon, and amounts may approach warning criteria. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain with thunderstorms possible. Amounts may approach warning criteria. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain, with thunderstorms possible. Amounts may approach warning criteria. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Low. Changes: The chance of upgrade for this Watch has been decreased to Low.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: Northwest winds may approach severe gale in exposed places. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Snow showers developing around midnight and 1 to 3 cm may settle about the summit, with lesser amounts down to 800 metres. Note, further snow expected Saturday night into Sunday morning.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Showers are expected to turn to snow Friday afternoon, then clearing late Friday evening. 1 to 3 cm may accumulate about the summit, with lesser amounts down to 800 metres. Another period of snow is expected Saturday evening when 3 to 6 cm can accumulate above 800 metres.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Snow showers developing around midnight and up to 1 cm may accumulate about the summit. Note, further snow expected Saturday night into Sunday morning.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Snow gradually lowering during Friday afternoon and evening. 5 to 10 cm may accumulate about the Tunnel entrance from Friday afternoon, with lesser amount above 500 metres from Friday evening, especially east of the Tunnel. Another 1 to 2 cm may accumulate above about 500 metres early Saturday morning. Saturday evening brings another round of snow to 800 metres, with another 10 to 20 cm accumulating about higher parts of the road.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited
